review_blob: solid triple, but nothing to write Belgium about. A little floral in taste. Also hints of caramel. Monk on bottle is a bit creeps yo.
first off - great label, now to the beer... its weird. I dont like it. It smells like rotten apples.

Well balanced heff, Smell and taste is sweet cloves, subtly citrus. My go-to at Three Tides, the brewpub attached to Marshall Wharf. Definitely check out Three Tides if your ever up in Mid Coast Maine.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: The smoky aftertaste emulated a campfire, but failed to capture the pleasantness of such a setting. I thought the aftertaste killed the beerperience.
Great saison - light yet savory, crisp and refreshing. I like the bird on the label a lot as well - that bird is so metallic I just wanna put it on my tongue and let it slowly dissolve.
IMHO This drinking beer is only good if your in Louisiana. Its boring and malty, but great to drink 6 of on a hot summer night in New Orleans.

Maltly triple with a smooth body and fine aftertaste. Heavy body brings the flavors forward. Sweet, as mentioned by others, but i feel it leaves something to be desired.

beer_brewer_name: Magners GB / Shepton Mallet Cider Mill (C&C; Group)
review_blob: My FAV! So Chammy. Pours well, aroma is deer-like, taste is a bit besides the point. Just look at the friggin DEER! A sparkling deercham - how can you give that a 2?
Rich hoppy Maine brew. Not too complex but makes a good session. Label is crude but the colors are eye-catching. First discovered on Vermont canoe trip.
